title: Version 1.1 Release Notes
content:
Happy New Year! A big thank you to everyone who provided feedback on Reddit and Discord—it was super useful in shaping this release!

General Updates

  • Removed JSON export and replaced it with a 'Share as URL' feature. Now you can share your character with others by copying the URL from the browser address bar.
  • Added a version number on the home page (under the attribution).
  • Introduced a News & Updates popup to track changes.
  • Added a world map popup on the Heritage step.
  • Moved the export feature into its own step for better usability.
  • Replaced icons in the action bar at the bottom with text for improved clarity.
  • Removed the back button from the action bar.

Fixes and Improvements

  • Fix: Resolved iOS page height issues in Safari.
  • Fix: Corrected typos in the Friends & Rivals step.
  • Restyled cards in the Friends & Rivals step for better readability.
  • Added multiline text support in the sheet painter (for Vice and Look).
  • Restyled the Name & Look step with larger input fields.

Actions Step Improvements

  • Added an option to enable Character Creation mode:
    • Limits available action dots to 7.
    • Sets a maximum of 2 dots per action.
  • Added an option to enable Mastery Advance mode:
    • Sets a maximum of 4 dots per action.
  • Default behavior (when neither mode is selected):
    • No limits on available action dots.
    • Maximum of 3 dots per action.
  • Increased the size of the + and - icons.
  • Made the action dot tally banner gold and sticky for better visibility.

Other Changes

  • Adjusted the wording of the hooded proprietor vice to be shorter.
  • Added attribution for the Library of Congress (source of the portrait images).
  • Removed the unused reference to Unsplash.

title: Version 1.2 Release Notes
content:
It's been a few weeks since the last update, and I'm excited to finally deploy version 1.2! Special thanks to Felix, who encouraged me to add Spanish localization, which led to a refactor of almost every part of the app. That let me add the German localization, too.

I reached out to John Harper on Bsky and he gave me permission to add the Deep Cuts sheets, so they can also be found in this update.

New Languages

  • Added Spanish language localization and Spanish sheets.
  • Added German language localization and German sheets.

Deep Cuts Sheets

I've added Deep Cuts sheets to the app. Just toggle the sheet type in the Export step to see the Deep Cuts version of your sheet. Note: Descriptions and ability names aren't adjusted, so the only thing that changes is the sheet itself.

Fixes & Improvements

  • Introducing Scoundry Lab, the public staging area for experimental new features that you can try out before the next release.
  • Added font support for the sheet painter with several fonts to pick from. Font choices are stored with the character data so it'll be persistent when you share your character.
  • Selected ink colors are now stored with the character data.

Fixes and Improvements

  • Fix: Resolved text issues in the contacts and aliases fields.
  • Added an opt-in popup for tracking analytics. (This can be changed anytime from the new settings popup.)
  • Adjusted the styling on the scoundrel cards.

title: Version 1.3 Release Notes
content:
Another Scoundry update is here!

Special thanks to the French Blades community members who performed the hard work of translating the app's content to French, as well as providing me with the French sheets. In addition to the French localization, I've done a few fixes and made some quality-of-life changes.

New Languages

  • Added French language localization and French sheets.

Fixes & Improvements

  • Fix: Fixed attribution text for the Library of Congress on the homepage.
  • The Vice text field in the Deep Cuts sheet now uses the correct text instead of the key.
  • Fixed a bug in which nobody was getting tracked even if they allowed it from the popup modal. Everyone should get asked again now.

Custom Portraits

  • You can enter a URL to an image to use as a custom portrait.
  • As long as the URL is accessible, the image will be as well. This means you can use images you've uploaded to Imgur, Google Drive, or any other image hosting service of your choice as long as it allows hotlinking.
